abstract.p: Lars Larsen letter disagrees with July 27 letter taking offense at Vikings cartoon illustrating July 13 article about cell phone use in Finland and Scandinavia

block.p: A letter on July 27 takes The New York Times to task for using cartoons of Vikings to illustrate an article about cell phone use in Scandinavia and Finland (''Wireless Valhalla: Hints of the Cellular Future,'' July 13). Don't worry. We Scandinavians are about the last ethnic group left that takes no offense at good-natured humor about ourselves. We take pride in ''Ole and Lena'' jokes, Lutheran church basement jokes and Garrison Keillor jokes.

A letter on July 27 takes The New York Times to task for using cartoons of Vikings to illustrate an article about cell phone use in Scandinavia and Finland (''Wireless Valhalla: Hints of the Cellular Future,'' July 13). Don't worry. We Scandinavians are about the last ethnic group left that takes no offense at good-natured humor about ourselves. We take pride in ''Ole and Lena'' jokes, Lutheran church basement jokes and Garrison Keillor jokes.

For a bunch of people who are noted for our ''dourness,'' we Scandinavians have a genuine sense of humor, which is simply the ability to laugh at yourself. We do that. And we welcome anyone else who wants to join in the fun. Our most famous Scandinavian is reported to have said that he once heard a joke that was so funny he could hardly keep from laughing.
